p: Physical examination revealed bilateral otitis externa (treated with topical medication), whilst neurological examination was unremarkable. Clinicopathologic evaluation and arterial blood pressure were unremarkable. Neurolocalisation was compatible with right peripheral vestibular system. Despite the resolution of otitis externa, the episodes frequency increased up to once a week. Further investigations included head CT and CSF analysis and were normal. Levetiracetam, Phenobarbital and Imipetoin were ineffective. After three years the dog still experiences daily vestibular paroxysms.
